enabled.description: Enabled to enable redis client in the server

address.description: Address is the host:port to connect to redis

password.description: Password, must match the password specified in the server configuration

db.description: DB to be selected after connecting to the server, 0 uses the default

dialTimeout.description: Dial timeout for establishing new connections, defaults to 5s

readTimeout.description:
Timeout for socket reads. If reached, commands will fail
with a timeout instead of blocking. Supported values:
  - `0` - default timeout (3 seconds).
  - `-1` - no timeout (block indefinitely).
  - `-2` - disables SetReadDeadline calls completely.

writeTimeout.description:
Timeout for socket writes. If reached, commands will fail
with a timeout instead of blocking.  Supported values:
  - `0` - default timeout (3 seconds).
  - `-1` - no timeout (block indefinitely).
  - `-2` - disables SetWriteDeadline calls completely.

maxRetries.description:
MaxRetries before giving up.
Default is 3 retries; -1 (not 0) disables retries.

minIdleConns.description:
MinIdleConns is useful when establishing new connection is slow.
Default is 0. the idle connections are not closed by default.

maxIdleConns.description:
Maximum number of idle connections.
Default is 0. the idle connections are not closed by default.

maxActiveConns.description:
Maximum number of connections allocated by the pool at a given time.
When zero, there is no limit on the number of connections in the pool.

cache.Config.description: Config for the redis client used to store key-value pairs

noCacheHeaders.description: noCacheHeaders is the header <-> match map pair to match in http for entity headers to remove

etagHeaders.description: etagHeaders is the string of entity headers to remove

cachecontrol.Config.description: Config is the config values for the cache-control middleware

enabled.description: Enabled authentication on the server, not recommended to disable

token.description: Token contains the token config settings for Datum issued tokens

supportedProviders.description: SupportedProviders are the supported oauth providers that have been configured

providers.description: Providers contains supported oauth2 providers configuration

config.Auth.description: Auth settings including oauth2 providers and datum token configuration

maxWorkers.description: MaxWorkers is the maximum number of workers in the pool

maxCapacity.description: MaxCapacity is the maximum number of tasks that can be queued

config.PondPool.description: PondPool contains the settings for the goroutine pool

debug.description: Debug enables debug mode for the server

dev.description: Dev enables echo's dev mode options

listen.description: Listen sets the listen address to serve the echo server on

shutdownGracePeriod.description: ShutdownGracePeriod sets the grace period for in flight requests before shutting down

readTimeout.description: ReadTimeout sets the maximum duration for reading the entire request including the body

writeTimeout.description: WriteTimeout sets the maximum duration before timing out writes of the response

idleTimeout.description: IdleTimeout sets the maximum amount of time to wait for the next request when keep-alives are enabled

readHeaderTimeout.description: ReadHeaderTimeout sets the amount of time allowed to read request headers

tls.description: TLS contains the tls configuration settings

cors.description: CORS contains settings to allow cross origin settings and insecure cookies

secure.description: Secure contains settings for the secure middleware

redirects.description: Redirect contains settings for the redirect middleware

cacheControl.description: CacheControl contains settings for the cache control middleware

mime.description: Mime contains settings for the mime middleware

graphPool.description: GraphPool contains settings for the goroutine pool used by the graph resolvers

enableGraphExtensions.description: EnableGraphExtensions enables the graph extensions for the graph resolvers

config.Server.description: Server settings for the echo server

enabled.description: Enabled turns on TLS settings for the server

certFile.description: CertFile location for the TLS server

certKey.description: CertKey file location for the TLS server

autoCert.description: AutoCert generates the cert with letsencrypt, this does not work on localhost

config.TLS.description: TLS settings for the server for secure connections

enabled.description: Enable or disable the CORS middleware

prefixes.description: Prefixes is a map of prefixes to allowed origins

allowOrigins.description: AllowOrigins is a list of allowed origins

cookieInsecure.description: CookieInsecure sets the cookie to be insecure

cors.Config.description: Config holds the cors configuration settings

sendGridApiKey.description: SendGridAPIKey is the SendGrid API key to authenticate with the service

fromEmail.description: FromEmail is the default email to send from

testing.description: Testing is a bool flag to indicate we shouldn't be sending live emails, and instead should be writing out fixtures

archive.description: Archive is only supported in testing mode and is what is tied through the mock to write out fixtures

datumListId.description: DatumListID is the UUID SendGrid spits out when you create marketing lists

adminEmail.description: AdminEmail is an internal group email configured within datum for email testing and visibility

consoleUrl.description: ConsoleURLConfig is the configuration for the URLs used in emails

marketingUrl.description: MarketingURLConfig is the configuration for the URLs used in marketing emails

emails.Config.description: Config for sending emails via SendGrid and managing marketing contacts

consoleBase.description: ConsoleBase is the base URL used for URL links in emails

verify.description: Verify is the path to the verify endpoint used in verification emails

invite.description: Invite is the path to the invite endpoint used in invite emails

reset.description: Reset is the path to the reset endpoint used in password reset emails

marketingBase.description: MarketingBase is the base URL used for marketing links in emails

subscriberVerify.description: SubscriberVerify is the path to the subscriber verify endpoint used in verification emails

emails.MarketingURLConfig.description: MarketingURLConfig for the datum marketing emails

entityTypes.description: EntityTypes is the list of entity types to create by default for the organization

entconfig.Config.description: Config holds the configuration for the ent server

useListUserService.description: use list services endpoint for object access

useListObjectServices.description: use list object services endpoint for object access

entconfig.Flags.description: Flags contains the flags for the server to allow use to test different code paths

debug.description: debug enables printing the debug database logs

databaseName.description: the name of the database to use with otel tracing

multiWrite.description: enables writing to two databases simultaneously

secondaryDbSource.description: dsn of the secondary database if multi-write is enabled

migrationProvider.description: migration provider to use for running migrations

enableHistory.description: enable history data to be logged to the database

hostUrl.description: host url with scheme of the openFGA API

modelFile.description: path to the fga model file

apiToken.description: api token for the openFGA client

clientId.description: client id for the openFGA client

clientSecret.description: client secret for the openFGA client

baseUrl.description: Base URL for the geodetic service

clientId.description: ClientID is the public identifier for the GitHub oauth2 client

clientSecret.description: ClientSecret is the secret for the GitHub oauth2 client

clientEndpoint.description: ClientEndpoint is the endpoint for the GitHub oauth2 client

scopes.description: Scopes are the scopes that the GitHub oauth2 client will request

redirectUrl.description: RedirectURL is the URL that the GitHub oauth2 client will redirect to after authentication with Github

github.ProviderConfig.description: ProviderConfig represents the configuration settings for a Github Oauth Provider

clientId.description: ClientID is the public identifier for the Google oauth2 client

clientSecret.description: ClientSecret is the secret for the Google oauth2 client

clientEndpoint.description: ClientEndpoint is the endpoint for the Google oauth2 client

scopes.description: Scopes are the scopes that the Google oauth2 client will request

redirectUrl.description: RedirectURL is the URL that the Google oauth2 client will redirect to after authentication with Google

google.ProviderConfig.description: ProviderConfig represents the configuration settings for a Google Oauth Provider

redirectUrl.description: RedirectURL is the URL that the OAuth2 client will redirect to after authentication with datum

github.description: Github contains the configuration settings for the Github Oauth Provider

google.description: Google contains the configuration settings for the Google Oauth Provider

webauthn.description: Webauthn contains the configuration settings for the Webauthn Oauth Provider

handlers.OauthProviderConfig.description: OauthProviderConfig represents the configuration for OAuth providers such as Github and Google

enabled.description: Enabled is a flag to determine if the Kafka event source is enabled

appName.description: AppName is the name of the application that is publishing events

address.description: Address is the address of the Kafka broker

addresses.description: Addresses is a list of addresses of the Kafka brokers

debug.description: Debug is a flag to determine if the Kafka client should run in debug mode

kafkaconfig.Config.description: Config is the configuration for the Kafka event source

enabled.description: Enabled indicates if the mime middleware should be enabled

mimeTypesFile.description: MimeTypesFile is the file to load mime types from

defaultContentType.description: DefaultContentType is the default content type to set if no mime type is found

mime.Config.description: Config defines the config for Mime middleware

environment.description: Environment to set for the service

stdout.description: StdOut settings for the stdout provider

otlp.description: OTLP settings for the otlp provider

otelx.Config.description: Config defines the configuration settings for opentelemetry tracing

endpoint.description: Endpoint to send the traces to

headers.description: Headers to send with the request

compression.description: Compression to use for the request

otelx.OTLP.description: OTLP settings for the otlp provider

pretty.description: Pretty enables pretty printing of the output

disableTimestamp.description: DisableTimestamp disables the timestamp in the output

otelx.StdOut.description: StdOut settings for the stdout provider

enabled.description: Enabled is a flag to enable or disable PostHog

apiKey.description: APIKey is the PostHog API Key

host.description: Host is the PostHog API Host

posthog.Config.description: Config is the configuration for PostHog

ratelimit.Config.description: Config defines the configuration settings for the default rate limiter

enabled.description: Enabled indicates if the redirect middleware should be enabled

redirects.description: Redirects is a map of paths to redirect to

code.description: Code is the HTTP status code to use for the redirect

redirect.Config.description: Config contains the types used in executing redirects via the redirect middleware

enabled.description: Enabled indicates if the secure middleware should be enabled

xssprotection.description: XSSProtection is the value to set the X-XSS-Protection header to - default is 1; mode=block

contenttypenosniff.description: ContentTypeNosniff is the value to set the X-Content-Type-Options header to - default is nosniff

xframeoptions.description: XFrameOptions is the value to set the X-Frame-Options header to - default is SAMEORIGIN

hstspreloadenabled.description: HSTSPreloadEnabled is a boolean to enable HSTS preloading - default is false

hstsmaxage.description: HSTSMaxAge is the max age to set the HSTS header to - default is 31536000

contentsecuritypolicy.description: ContentSecurityPolicy is the value to set the Content-Security-Policy header to - default is default-src 'self'

referrerpolicy.description: ReferrerPolicy is the value to set the Referrer-Policy header to - default is same-origin

cspreportonly.description: CSPReportOnly is a boolean to enable the Content-Security-Policy-Report-Only header - default is false

secure.Config.description: Config contains the types used in the mw middleware

signingKey.description: SigningKey must be a 16, 32, or 64 character string used to encode the cookie

encryptionKey.description: EncryptionKey must be a 16, 32, or 64 character string used to encode the cookie

domain.description: Domain is the domain for the cookie, leave empty to use the default value of the server

sessions.Config.description: Config contains the configuration for the session store

kid.description: KID represents the Key ID used in the configuration.

audience.description: Audience represents the target audience for the tokens.

refreshAudience.description: RefreshAudience represents the audience for refreshing tokens.

issuer.description: Issuer represents the issuer of the tokens

accessDuration.description: AccessDuration represents the duration of the access token is valid for

refreshDuration.description: RefreshDuration represents the duration of the refresh token is valid for

refreshOverlap.description: RefreshOverlap represents the overlap time for a refresh and access token

jwksEndpoint.description: JWKSEndpoint represents the endpoint for the JSON Web Key Set

keys.description: Keys represents the key pairs used for signing the tokens

generateKeys.description: GenerateKeys is a boolean to determine if the keys should be generated

tokens.Config.description: Config defines the configuration settings for authentication tokens used in the server

enabled.description: Enabled is a flag to enable or disable the OTP service

codeLength.description: CodeLength is the length of the OTP code

issuer.description: Issuer is the issuer for TOTP codes

redis.description: WithRedis configures the service with a redis client

secret.description: Secret stores a versioned secret key for cryptography functions

recoveryCodeCount.description: RecoveryCodeCount is the number of recovery codes to generate

recoveryCodeLength.description: RecoveryCodeLength is the length of a recovery code

displayName.description: DisplayName is the site display name

relyingPartyId.description:
RelyingPartyID is the relying party identifier
set to localhost for development, no port

requestOrigins.description:
RequestOrigins the origin domain(s) for authentication requests
include the scheme and port

maxDevices.description: MaxDevices is the maximum number of devices that can be associated with a user

enforceTimeout.description:
EnforceTimeout at the Relying Party / Server. This means if enabled and the user takes too long that even if the browser does not
enforce a timeout, the server will

timeout.description: Timeout is the timeout in seconds

webauthn.ProviderConfig.description: ProviderConfig represents the configuration settings for a Webauthn Provider

refreshInterval.description: RefreshInterval determines how often to reload the config

server.description: Server contains the echo server settings

entConfig.description: EntConfig contains the ent configuration used by the ent middleware

auth.description: Auth contains the authentication token settings and provider(s)

authz.description: Authz contains the authorization settings for fine grained access control

db.description: DB contains the database configuration for the ent client

geodetic.description: Geodetic contains the geodetic client configuration

redis.description: Redis contains the redis configuration for the key-value store

tracer.description: Tracer contains the tracing config for opentelemetry

email.description: Email contains email sending configuration for the server

sessions.description: Sessions config for user sessions and cookies

posthog.description: PostHog contains the configuration for the PostHog analytics

totp.description: TOTP contains the configuration for the TOTP provider

ratelimit.description: Ratelimit contains the configuration for the rate limiter

publisherConfig.description: EventPublisher contains the configuration for the event publisher

description: Config contains the configuration for the datum server
